dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking a document from his pocket and proffering it to Sheriff) I'm a messenger at the State House. This is from the Governor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's from the Governor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The reprieve for Earl Williams.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stunned) For who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amiably) Earl Williams. The reprieve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: W-wait a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bursting forth) The Governor gave me his word of honor he wouldn't interfere. Two days ago!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you fell for it, Pete. It frightens me what I'd like to do to you. (to Pinkus) Who else knows about this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They were all standing around when he wrote it. It was after they got back from fishing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Sheriff) Get the Governor on the phone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (helpfully) You can't get him on the phone. He's out duckshooting now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fishing! Duckshooting! How do you like that. A guy does nothing more strenuous for forty years than play pinochle -- he gets elected Governor and right away he thinks he's Tarzan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thrusting the document at the Mayor) Read it! Insane, he says. (shaking a finger in Pinkus' face) He knows very well that Williams ain't insane!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. But I -- MAYOR (interrupting) Pure politics!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An attempt to ruin us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading) Dementia praecox Oh-h-h!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got to think fast before those lying reporters get hold of this. What'll we tell 'em?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell 'em the party is through in this State on account of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, Fred -- (into phone) Hello... this is Hartman -- MAYOR (apoplectic) And you can tell 'em as an afterthought that I want your resignation now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (from the phone) Sssh. Wait, Fred. (excitedly, into phone) What?... Where?... Where? Holy Moses!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got him! (back to phone) Wait a minute -- hold the wire. (to the Mayor) They got Earl Williams surrounded -- the Riot Squad has -- in his house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell 'em to hold the wire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did. (into phone) Hold the wire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cover up that transmitter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, listen! You never arrived here with this -- reprieve. Get it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blinking) Yes, I did, just now. Don't you remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much do you make a week?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) How much do you make a week? What's your salary?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly) Forty dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) No -- don't out me off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How would you like to have a job for three hundred and fifty dollars a month. That's almost a hundred dollars a week!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who? Me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exasperated) Who do you think!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, listen. There's a fine opening for a fellow like you in the City Sealer's office.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The City Sealer's office!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean here in the city?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (foaming) Yes, yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (at phone) Well, wait a minute, will you? I'm in conference.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a very deliberate intellect) No, I couldn't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I couldn't work in the city. You see, I've got my family in the country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (desperate) But you could bring 'em in here! We'll pay all your expenses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with vast thought) No, I don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For heaven's sake, why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got two kids going to school there, and if I changed them from one town to another, they'd lose a grade.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, they wouldn't -- they'd gain one! And I guarantee that they'll graduate with highest honors!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lured) Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Hold your horses -- will you, Olsen? Hurry up, Fred!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now what do you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This puts me in a peculiar hole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it doesn't. (hands him the reprieve) Now, remember: you never delivered this. (rushing him to the door) You got caught in the traffic, or something. (opening door) Now, get out of here and don't let anybody see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how do I know...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come in and see me in my office tomorrow. What's your name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pinkus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking out his wallet) All right, Mr. Pinkus, all you've got to do is lay low and keep your mouth shut. Here! (he hands him a card) Go to this address. It's a nice, homey little place, and they'll take care of you for the night. Just tell 'em Fred sent you. And here's fifty dollars on account.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone, desperately) Will you wait, Olsen? I'll tell you in a minute!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You forgot to tell me what a City Sealer has to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning hastily toward Pinkus) I'll explain it tomorrow!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it hard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! It's easy -- it's very easy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleadingly, into phone) Just one second -- PINKUS That's good, because my health ain't what it used to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pushing him out the door) We'll fix that, too. (he closes the door after him)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone -- one more plea) Just -- one -- second!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (huskily) All right. Tell 'em to shoot to kill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shoot to kill, I said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, Fred. There's that reprieve if they ever find out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody reprieved that policeman he murdered. Now, do as I tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Hello, Olsen... Listen... (his voice is weak) Shoot to kill... That's the orders pass the word along... No! We dont want him! And listen, Olsen, five- hundred bucks for the guy that does the job... Yes, I'll be right out there. (hangs up) Well, I hope that's the right thing to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now take that guilty look off your face, Pete -- and stop trembling like a horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mopping his brow) If we didn't have election Tuesday I'd have this on my conscience.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR OUTSIDE PRESS ROOM MED. SHOT Louie comes from the direction of the stairs and crosses toward door to Press Room. He pauses a moment, puts his hand in his pocket, pulls out some bills, counts them and opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PRESS ROOM MED. SHOT Hildy is still pacing, pounding her hands together and glancing every so often at the clock on the wall. Suddenly she crosses to her phone, picks up transmitter -- HILDY (into phone) Will you try -- LOUIE'S VOICE Hildy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She drops the phone and hurries towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes Bruce's wallet out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He suddenly realizes what he's said and sprints for the door. Hildy chucks something at him. It just misses as he ducks out of the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (wheeling towards door) Louie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you got my dough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, sure. The boss sent me over with it. Four hundred dollars, wasn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four hundred and fifty and I'll cut your throat if you try any tricks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, all right. You can't blame a guy for tryin', can you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on with that money!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: First you got to sign a receipt. (he pulls out a receipt)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep your shirt on. I got it -- right here. (he picks out money and counts) One hundred -- two hundred -- three hundred -- four hundred -- and fifty. Now sign.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabs money and signs) Here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks. So long, Hildy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabbing him) So long, nothing! Where's Bruce Baldwin's wallet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: None of that innocent stuff, you double-crossing hyena! You stuck Bruce Baldwin in jail this afternoon on a phony charge that he swiped your watch, and you frisked his wallet! Now, give me that wallet or I'll stick you in jail and it won't be on any phony charge either! It'll be for life!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now don't get excited, Hildy! I don't know what you're talking about -- but is this Mr. Baldwin's wallet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabbing it) You know it is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't frisk him. He must have dropped it in Burns' office. I didn't know whose it was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- and you don't know that your cheap boss has had Mr. Baldwin arrested again -- do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) What -- already? Why, the dame left only a minute before I did!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ANOTHER ANGLE Hildy casts a savage look after the departed Louie, takes another look at the clock and grabs a phone and starts to dial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy stops short, arrested by a sound from the open window. She turns and sees Earl Williams, looking more inoffensive and exhausted than ever, indeed on the verge of collapse. He carries a large revolver. The search-lights that have been playing in the courtyard strike into the windows again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy drops the phone back on the hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He advances steadily toward Hildy, the gun aimed at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy starts walking toward him, slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy sneaks another step forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points the gun at Hildy, pulls the trigger and we hear a faint "click!"
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: th Precinct Station House?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing gun at her) Drop that phone --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (supporting himself by holding on to edge of desk) You're not going to phone anybody where I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bracing herself) Put down that gun, Earl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to shoot me, Earl. I'm your friend, remember? I've got to write that story about your "Production for Use".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes -- that's right. Production for use.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Earl, you don't want to hurt your friends, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe you're my friend and maybe you're not -- but don't come any nearer. You can't trust anybody in this crazy world. Say, I'll bet I could shoot you from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure you could, Earl -- but you wouldn't want to do that, would you? You wouldn't want to kill anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, you're right. I don't want to kill anybody. All I want to do is be let alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Earl, there's just one thing I ought to clear up for the interview.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that? Only -- you're getting too near. I don't trust anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't blame you, Earl. (another step forward) If I were in your place I wouldn't trust anybody, either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly) Keep away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weakly) I guess I used all the shells.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: TWO SHOT He drops the gun and clutches at the edge of the desk for support. Hildy lurches forward and she grabs the other side of the desk for support. And at this moment she looks more tired than he does. She looks at Earl and breathes heavily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Earl, you must never do that again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm awful tired. I couldn't go through another day like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (more her old self now) Well, maybe you think I could!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as she retrieves the gun and jams it in her purse, jumps to the windows, pulls down the shades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy crosses swiftly to the door, locks it and puts out the lights, so that they are visible only faintly in the light from the areaway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy is looking around for a hiding place for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He abruptly crumples and falls to the floor. Hildy stands for a second, desperate. Then she picks him up and half carries, half drags him over toward a chair and places him in it. Then she makes a quick dash for her phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another phone there rings. Hildy answers it, propping the receiver of her own phone between ear and shoulder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not afraid to die. I was tellin' the fella that when he handed me the gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't talk too loud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (babbling on as she moves about) Wakin' me up in the middle of the night -- talkin' to me about things they don't understand. Callin' me a Bolshevik. I'm an anarchist. It's got nothin' to do with bombs. It's the philosophy that guarantees every man freedom. You see that, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure I do, Earl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish they'd take me back and hang me. I done my best.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Hello... Gimme Walter Burns -- quick!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: HILDY AT PHONE HILDY (into second phone) Hello -- hel -- Oh, hello, Bruce... Oh, Bruce, please -- I know I said I'd be down in fifteen minutes, but something terrific's happened! Hang on, Bruce -- (into first phone) Walter?... Hildy. Come over here -- right away!... Wait! (into second phone) Bruce, just a second, Bruce -- I'll explain everything. (into first phone) Walter! Get this: I've got Earl Williams... Yes! Here in the Press Room... Honest! On the level. Hurry -- I need you. She hangs up and turns into second phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a knocking on the door, but she doesn't hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a click from the phone. He has hung up. Hildy dejectedly hangs up the phone. There is the sound of knocking on the door. She springs up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bruce, this is the biggest thing that ever happened... (lowers voice) I just captured Earl Williams -- you know -- the murderer --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bruce, I'll be down -- Well, Bruce, the minute I turn him over to the paper I'll be right down. Bruce, don't you -- Bruce, I can't now -- I can't, don't you realize?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: taking in door. Hildy glares apprehensively, then crosses to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy carefully unlocks the door. Mollie bounds in like a wildcat and seizes her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She manages to relock the door, then turns, leaning against it, facing Mollie.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cautiously) Who's there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's me, Mollie Malloy! Let me in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they gone? You know where they are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute, Mollie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: HILDY AND MOLLIE MOLLIE They got him surrounded some place -- gonna shoot him like a dog!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a sound -- a groan -- as Williams starts to come to.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mollie, they haven't got him. You gotta help me, Mollie! We've got to do something!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (spinning around) What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet, Mollie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's somethin' funny going on around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mollie crosses to wall and switches on the lights. She sees Williams, sobs and rushes over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EARL AND MOLLIE Mollie gets down on her knees and begins ministering to Earl. He opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mollie begins to sob.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Mollie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE SHOT Hildy comes over and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door is tried outside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet, Mollie, quiet!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (putting out hand to stroke her hair) Don't cry, Mollie, there's nothing to cry about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you get here, Earl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Down the drainpipe. I didn't mean to shoot him. You believe me, don't you, Mollie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (coming up) Of course I believe you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I forgot to thank you for those roses. They were beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right, Mr. Williams... (to Hildy) You're a woman. You got to help us. You got to get him out of here, some place where I can take care of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop screaming, Mollie or we're sunk. I'm trying to think of something before those reporters get back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let 'em take me. It's better that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- I'll never let 'em!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll get him! They'll get him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ssh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR OUTSIDE PRESS ROOM DOOR CLOSE SHOT Endicott at door is trying to get in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who locked the door?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (calling) Just a second, Mike --- (whispering to Mollie) Mollie, I got it!
direction.name: direction

location: PRESS ROOM BACK TO HILDY HILDY

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT AT DESK Hildy jumps in to the desk and opens it, turning to cry in a tense whisper to Earl:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can you get in this desk?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR CLOSE SHOT Wilson is there too, now, and he and Endicott are pounding on the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mollie and Earl are with Hildy in front of desk now. They are speaking in whispers.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: PRESS ROOM HILDY, MOLLIE AND EARL

dialogue.raw_text: What good'll it do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll get you out in ten minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Open up there, will you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crying) All right -- all right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is further and louder pounding on the door. Earl gets in the desk. Hildy and Mollie pull the roll-top down over him.
direction.name: direction

location: PRESS ROOM HILDY, MOLLIE AND EARL HILDY

dialogue.raw_text: (to Earl) Go on! (shoving him to desk) Please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll find me anyhow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling) I'm coming! (to Earl) Keep dead quiet. Don't even breathe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Earl) I'll be right here. I won't leave you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (giving door a terrific kick) Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PRESS ROOM CLOSE SHOT HILDY AND MOLLIE HILDY (to Mollie) Mollie, drop down here! You've fainted!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy rapidly unbuttons Mollie's waist and throws it back. The kicking at the door continues.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's the idea?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind! Just play dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hildy rushes over to windows and pulls up the shades. Mollie is lying quietly on the floor with her eyes closed. Hildy rushes over to water cooler and gets a paper cup full of water. She throws the water in Mollie's face.

direction.raw_text: Hildy crosses swiftly to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (spluttering) Hey -- HILDY (fiercely) Shut up, you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The door opens in Endicott's face and there is Miss Johnson, quite cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They catch sight of Mollie, stretched out on the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Kind of exclusive, ain't you? We got calls to make, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Run down and get some smelling salts, will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smelling salts! What's going on here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mollie Malloy -- what happened to her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as Endicott and Wilson enter room) Came up here -- had hysterics and passed out. I've been trying to get her to come to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PRESS ROOM MED. SHOT Mollie is shaking her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy and Endicott lift Mollie and seat her in a chair. Wilson crosses to his phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She looks as though she's going to come to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me a hand with her, will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. (lifting Mollie) Up you go, Mollie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: WILSON AT PHONE WILSON (into Phone) City Desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Taking in Hildy, Wilson and Mollie and Endicott.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She'll be all right. (crosses to his phone) The Desk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Well, they surrounded the house, all right, only they forgot to tell Williams, and he wasn't there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT TAKING IN DOOR Murphy comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murphy crosses to his phone. McCue comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up.

direction.raw_text: Schwartz comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks up his phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up -- puts his feet on the desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing Hildy, who has been fastening Mollie's blouse) Hildy, I thought you were gone -- HILDY Well -- I was going, but Mollie fainted away and I thought I ought to do what I could.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some Hallowe'en goin' on outside. The whole police force standing on it's ear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (panting) What a chase!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) No luck on Williams, yet -- call you back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Okay, later.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, get off that trapeze! (indicating desk, off) There's your story! Smear it all over the front page -- Earl Williams caught by the Morning Post! And take all the credit -- I covered your story for you and I got myself in a fine mess doing it -- and now I'm getting out! I know I told you that twice before today -- but this time I mean it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You drooling idiot! What do you mean, you're getting out! There are three hundred and sixty-five days in the year one can get married -- but how many times have you got a murderer locked up in a desk? -- Once in a lifetime! Hildy, you've got the whole city by the seat of the pants!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, but -- BURNS (interrupting) You know! You've got the brain of a pancake! That wasn't just a story you covered -- it was a revolution! Hildy! This is the greatest yarn in journalism since Livingstone discovered Stanley for the New York Herald! (quickly closes the door)

dialogue.raw_text: Don't get technical at a time like this! Do you realize what you've done? You've taken a city that's been graft-ridden for forty years under the same old gang and with this yarn you're kicking 'em out and giving us a chance to have the same kind of government that New York's having under La Guardia! We'll make such monkeys out of these ward-heelers next Tuesday that nobody'll vote for them -- not even their wives!

dialogue.raw_text: (the fire upon her) I'd like to think.

dialogue.raw_text: You guys better quit politics and take in washing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking over the reprieve) Sheriff, this document is authentic! Earl Williams has been reprieved, this Commonwealth has been spared the painful necessity of shedding blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Save that for the Tribune.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Pinkus) What did you say your name was -- Pinkus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's the picture of my wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A very fine-looking women.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mysteriously angered) She's good enough for me! And if I was to go home and tell my wife -- MAYOR I understand perfectly, Mr. Pinkus, and as long as I am Mayor -- BURNS Which ought to be about three hours more, I'd say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just until we can get out a special edition asking for your impeachment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And your arrest. You'll each get about ten years, I think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't make any hasty decisions, Mr. Burns, you might run into a thumping big libel suit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to run into the Governor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to brush it off) Now, my old friend the Governor and I understand each other perfectly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eagerly) And so do I!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with superb contempt) So do you what, you hoodoo! (to Pinkus, suavely) And now, Mr. Pinkus, if you'll come with us, we'll take you over to the Warden's office and deliver this reprieve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dreamily) Wait till those two future jailbirds read the Morning Post tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How was that for a tight squeeze?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell me you were worried!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Worried! I was petrified. Weren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-uh. As long as we were in there together pitching -- they couldn't lick us. Well, it's been a lot of fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) I mean -- working together. Just like the old days. The things we've been through, Hildy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've certainly been in some swell jams.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember the time we broke into the D.A.'s office, and copied Fifi Randell's diary?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. What about the time we hid the missing heiress in the sauerkraut factory? Six scoop interviews!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah - but that time we stole Old Lady Haggerty's stomach off the Coroner's physician. We proved she was poisoned though, didn't we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) We sure did, but we had to go in hiding for a week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the Shoreland Hotel. And our only chaperon was the poor old lady's stomach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't remind me. That's how we happened to --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Hildy. I didn't mean to be making love to another man's fiancee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right, Walter. It's as much my fault as yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glancing at the clock) Bruce is making the nine o'clock train. I told him you'd be on it -- unless you want to write this story yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if it's my last story, I'd like it to be a good one. But -- I guess I can't, Walter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suit yourself, kid. This isn't for me to decide. Of course, you could make a later train and still be in Albany tomorrow morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I suppose I could. But, Walter -- BURNS He's going to have you the rest of his life, Hildy. Can't you give me another hour?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what to do, Walter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flip a coin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. (takes coin from her bag) Heads I go -- tails I stay to write the story. Ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: BURNS gazing nervously at the hand holding the coin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: BURNS AND HILDY She flips and catches the coin. She holds it tightly clasped in her hand, afraid to look. They stare at each other a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She puts the coin away without looking at it. Burns rushes to her, tries to take her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (nervously) Well -- what is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost breaking) What's the difference? I'm going to write that story -- and you know it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hildy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (furiously) Don't touch me! I'm not doing it for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Then why are you doing it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I'm a newspaper woman, Heaven help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CITY ROOM - Hildy typing away furiously. Copy Boy tearing sheets from her typewriter as she writes. Burns coming in and tearing sheets from typewriter. Linetype machines. Presses going. Headline: THE POST SAVES EARL WILLIAMS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Headline: POST SAVES EARL WILLIAMS! Over this sound of newsboys calling "Extra! Extra!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to rest of story: "Impeachment Proceedings Launched Against Mayor For Attempting to Conceal Governor's Reprieve!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to the by-line -- By Hildegarde Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to disclose Burns and Hildy looking at paper on Burns' desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (enthusiastically) The greatest yarn ever written by anybody. My hat's off to you, Hildy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimly) Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what a way to quit. While you're still champion! That's the way to leave, Hildy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Only -- only I'm not leaving, Walter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean? Bruce'll be waiting for you in Albany.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, he won't. I wired him that I wasn't coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: BURNS
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where'd you wire him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the nine o'clock train. That's the one he took, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: HILDY It's awfully clear now. Bruce needs a wife who can give him a home -- and affection -- and peace. I couldn't do that for him, Walter. I'm what you made me -- a cheap reporter who'd give up her soul for a story!... Is that job still open?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Both jobs are open, Hildy. The paper -- and being Mrs. Walter Burns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, Walter, but it's no good. We tried it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, it was good -- it was wonderful! Only you expected it to be like other marriages. It can't be like other marriages -- we're different! We're a different world. Look at what we went through today. I wouldn't trade that for any honeymoon in the world. I bet you wouldn't, either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A fine honeymoon, with a murderer right in the boudoir! And that other honeymoon in a coal mine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what makes it romantic. Every other married couple goes away on a honeymoon and for two weeks the bride knows just where the groom is, and vice versa. But us -- you never know where I am and I'm not sure where you are. That's Romance!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, maybe I'd like to know just once!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hildy, if that's what you want, all right. We'll even go to -- how about Niagara Falls?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumping) Niagara Falls! Walter, you don't mean that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure I do. And I'll tell you something else -- I'd like a baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, I can't last forever. I want a son I can train to take my place on this paper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What would you do if it was a daughter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if she looked like you -- Say! My brains and your looks -- that mightn't be such a bad combination.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with my brains?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the good of arguing about something that probably doesn't exist? Look, Hildy, I'm proposing to you. What do you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'd like to be lady-like and think it over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to rush you. Take a couple of seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: AT DOOR Louie marches in with a judge, half-dressed. Louie has the judge in a tight grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT BURNS Hello, Judge!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is an outrage, Mr. Burns! Sending a gunman to kidnap me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, wait a minute, Judge. This isn't a kidnapping. You've got the legal power to perform a marriage ceremony, haven't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now don't argue, Hildy. (to Judge) How about it, Judge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but -- BURNS Then go ahead. Come on, Hildy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody's going to rush me into anything! (as Louie sticks a gun in her ribs) You keep away from me! (but she's scared)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CITY ROOM MED. SHOT Reporters are standing on desks to watch through the glass partition of Burns' office.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be doggoned! A shotgun marriage!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't they usually keep the gun on the man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BURNS' OFFICE CLOSE SHOT JUDGE reading the marriage ceremony.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: so long as you both do live?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: HILDY That's what he said the last time. Don't believe him, Judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burns starts searching his pockets, then, to Hildy:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hildy, from this time on no tricks, no double-crossing -- everything on the level!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not fooling anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) "Hildegarde Johnson, will you have this man as your wedded husband, to live together in the ordinances and estate of Matrimony?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What would you do with a gun in your back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (poking her) Quiet!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Will you love him, comfort him, honor and keep him in sickness or in health; -- HILDY If I know where he is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and, forsaking all others, keep thee only unto him, so long as you both do live?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will -- if he will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Burns) Have you got a ring?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he takes ring off) How about Bruce's?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter, you can't do that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, I can. Look at the policy I gave him! (placing Bruce's ring on Hildy's finger) "With this ring I thee wed and with all my worldly goods I thee endow: And thereto I plight thee my troth."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CITY ROOM CLOSE SHOT REPORTER Say, I'm surprised she got the ring back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURNS' OFFICE CLOSE SHOT GROUP
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burns throws his arms around Hildy and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildy turns over copy of the extra lying on Burns' desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: pronounce you Man and Wife."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hildy, darling!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes -- 'Hildy, darling'. I'm just a fool. That's what I am. I know what it's going to be like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll be Heaven!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, Heaven! You've probably thought up another coal mine to send me down in -- to get a new story for your paper!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: HILDY She stops cold.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Walter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : NEWSPAPER -- "COUNTERFEIT PASSER CAUGHT!" "Attempting to pass five hundred dollars worth of counterfeit money at the Union station, a man giving his name as Bruce Baldwin of Albany, New York, was arrested last night -- " TWO SHOT BURNS AND HILDY HILDY Counterfeit money! That's the money you sent me, Walter! You -- you -- WALTER (starting to run) But, Hildy, listen -- MED. FULL SHOT Burns retreats from Hildy, she runs after him. He dashes through glass-paned door into adjoining office. Hildy throws her bag at him and it smashes the glass pane in the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADJOINING OFFICE CLOSE SHOT BURNS AND HILDY She is pursuing him around table similar to one in Burns' office.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But, Hildy -- I can explain -- HILDY You -- you!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BURNS' OFFICE CLOSE SHOT JUDGE AND LOUIE LOUIE I think it's going to work out all right this time.
direction.name: direction
